wcsaxes.title: number of World Coordinate System axes
wcsaxes.description: The number of World Coordinate System axes. These axes are used to convert pixel positions to Right Ascension and Declination. For level 1 and level 2 science data, WCSAXES = 2. For spectroscopic modes, WCSAXES = 3, to include the wavelength dimension.
wcsaxes.source: Science and Operations Center Project Reference Database (PRD)
wcsaxes.misc: Not in original file. Assumed destination

crpix1.title: Axis 1 pixel coordinate of the reference point
crpix1.description: Location of the reference point in the image for axis 1.  Note that the reference point may lie outside the image.
crpix1.source: Science and Operations Center Project Reference Database (PRD)

crpix2.title: Axis 2 pixel coordinate of the reference point
crpix2.description: Location of the reference point in the image for axis 2.  Note that the reference point may lie outside the image.
crpix2.source: Science and Operations Center Project Reference Database (PRD)

crpix3.title: Axis 3 pixel coordinate of the reference point
crpix3.description: Location of the reference point in the image for axis 3.  Note that the reference point may lie outside the image.

crval1.title: Axis 1 coordinate value at reference point
crval1.description: World Coordinate value at the reference point, axis 1.
crval1.source: Science and Operations Center Project Reference Database (PRD)

crval2.title: Axis 2 coordinate value at reference point
crval2.description: World Coordinate value at the reference point, axis 2.
crval2.source: Science and Operations Center Project Reference Database (PRD)

crval3.title: Axis 3 coordinate value at reference point
crval3.description: World Coordinate value at the reference point, axis 3.
crval3.source: Science and Operations Center Project Reference Database (PRD)

ctype1.title: Axis 1 type
ctype1.description: Type for the world coordinate axis 1.
ctype1.source: Science and Operations Center Project Reference Database (PRD)

ctype2.title: Axis 2 type
ctype2.description: Type for the world coordinate axis 2.
ctype2.source: Science and Operations Center Project Reference Database (PRD)

ctype3.title: Axis 3 type
ctype3.description: Type for the world coordinate axis 3.
ctype3.source: Science and Operations Center Project Reference Database (PRD)

cunit1.title: Axis 1 units
cunit1.description: Physical units of CRVAL and CDELT for axis 1. Units for celestial coordinate systems defined in the FITS standard must be degrees.
cunit1.source: Science and Operations Center Project Reference Database (PRD)

cunit2.title: Axis 2 units
cunit2.description: Physical units of CRVAL and CDELT for axis 2. Units for celestial coordinate systems defined in the FITS standard must be degrees.
cunit2.source: Science and Operations Center Project Reference Database (PRD)

cunit3.title: Axis 3 units
cunit3.description: Physical units of CRVAL and CDELT for axis 3. Units for celestial coordinate systems defined in the FITS standard must be degrees.
cunit3.source: Science and Operations Center Project Reference Database (PRD)

cdelt1.title: Axis 1 coordinate increment at reference point
cdelt1.description: Increment of the world coordinate at the reference point for axis 1.  The value must not be zero.
cdelt1.source: Science and Operations Center Project Reference Database (PRD)

cdelt2.title: Axis 2 coordinate increment at reference point
cdelt2.description: Increment of the world coordinate at the reference point for axis 2.  The value must not be zero.
cdelt2.source: Science and Operations Center Project Reference Database (PRD)

cdelt3.title: Axis 3 coordinate increment at reference point
cdelt3.description: Increment of the world coordinate at the reference point for axis 3.  The value must not be zero.

pc1_1.title: Linear transformation matrix
pc1_1.description: Linear transformation matrix between pixel axes 1 and intermediate coordinate axes 1.  The PC1_1 matrix must not be singular.
pc1_1.source: Science and Operations Center Project Reference Database (PRD)

pc1_2.title: Linear transformation matrix
pc1_2.description: Linear transformation matrix between pixel axes 2 and intermediate coordinate axes 1.  The PC1_2 matrix must not be singular.
pc1_2.source: Science and Operations Center Project Reference Database (PRD)

pc1_3.title: Linear transformation matrix
pc1_3.description: Linear transformation matrix between pixel axes 1 and intermediate coordinate axes 3.
pc1_3.source: Science and Operations Center Project Reference Database (PRD)

pc2_1.title: Linear transformation matrix
pc2_1.description: Linear transformation matrix between pixel axes 1 and intermediate coordinate axes 2.  The PC2_1 matrix must not be singular.
pc2_1.source: Science and Operations Center Project Reference Database (PRD)

pc2_2.title: Linear transformation matrix
pc2_2.description: Linear transformation matrix between pixel axes 2 and intermediate coordinate axes 2.  The PC2_2 matrix must not be singular.
pc2_2.source: Science and Operations Center Project Reference Database (PRD)

pc2_3.title: Linear transformation matrix
pc2_3.description: Linear transformation matrix between pixel axes 2 and intermediate coordinate axes 3.
pc2_3.source: Science and Operations Center Project Reference Database (PRD)

pc3_1.title: Linear transformation matrix
pc3_1.description: Linear transformation matrix between pixel axes 1 and intermediate coordinate axes 3.  The PC3_1 matrix must not be singular.
pc3_1.source: Science and Operations Center Project Reference Database (PRD)
pc3_1.misc: Not in original file.0 for MIRI, 1 for NIRSPEC

pc3_2.title: Linear transformation matrix
pc3_2.description: Linear transformation matrix between pixel axes 2 and intermediate coordinate axes 3.  The PC3_2 matrix must not be singular.
pc3_2.source: Science and Operations Center Project Reference Database (PRD)

pc3_3.title: Linear transformation matrix
pc3_3.description: Linear transformation matrix between pixel axes 3 and intermediate coordinate axes 3.
pc3_3.source: Science and Operations Center Project Reference Database (PRD)

s_region.title: spatial extent of the observation, footprint
s_region.description:
<s_region> ::= [<region>...]
<region> ::= <circle> | <polygon>
<circle> ::= CIRCLE <coordsys> <coordpair> <radius in decimal degrees>
<polygon> ::= POLYGON <coordsys> <coordpair> <coordpair> [<coordpair> ...]
<coordsys> ::= ICRS
<coordpair> ::= <decimal value for RA> < decimal value for Declination>

vparity.title: Parity (sense) of aperture settings (1, -1)
vparity.description: Relative sense of rotation between Ideal xy and V2V3
vparity.source: Science and Operations Center Project Reference Database (PRD)
vparity.misc: The V2/V3 coordinate system appears on the sky with the V2 axis to the left and V3 up. Thus the angle from V2 to V3 is clockwise. The Ideal coordinate system has the x axis to the right and y up. Thus the angle from x to y is anti-clockwise. The VPARITY value indicates the relative parity between these two coordinate systems. In the situation described above the parity is -1, because the V2-to-V3 and x-to-y angles are opposite from one another. OSS coordinates has x to the left and y up, hence in that case the parity is +1 (the same).

v3yangle.title: Direction angle in V3 (Y)
v3yangle.description: Angle from V3 axis to Ideal y axis (deg)
v3yangle.source: Science and Operations Center Project Reference Database (PRD)
v3yangle.misc: The angle from the V3 axis to the y axis in the Ideal coordinate system, measured anti-clockwise.

waverange_start.title: Lower bound of the default wavelength range
waverange_start.description: Lower bound of the default wavelength range.

waverange_end.title: Upper bound of the default wavelength range
waverange_end.description: Upper bound of the default wavelength range.

ps3_0.title: Coordinate table extension name
ps3_0.description: Indicates the name (EXTNAME) of the extension containing the lookup table to be used to assign coordinate values to axis 3 (spectral/wavelength axis) of the science data.

ps3_1.title: Coordinate table column name
ps3_1.description: Indicates the column name within the table extension named in PS3_0 that contains the coordinate values to be assigned to axis 3 of the science data.
